resources.string:
Forward Stride

 • Start slow and use small steps
 • Keep the center of gravity low
 • Practice to stay on one foot
 • Look forward and not down

T-Stop

 • Start stopping with a low velocity
 • For the begging only use a few rolls at a time
 • Grind the ground for a few seconds then gradually progress
 • To increase pressure properly ensure that the front knee is bent low
Be able to steer left and right

Parallel Turn

 • Notice the inside and outside edges of your skates
 • Start with slight turns and then progress into sharper ones
 • Additionally lead with the shoulders and hips into the turn
 • Move the balance into the middle wheels and not the front or back

Slalom: Fish

 • After a parallel turn quickly scissor switch your stance
 • Shift the balance to the opposite side during each stance switch
 • Swing the arms into the opposite direction of the turns for balance
 • Keep the upper body straight
Use little hops to get over obstacles

(Not a) jump!

 • Start with small hops
 • Swing the arms up for height
 • Bent the knees when landing to soften the impact
 • Additionally align the shoulders with the hips, knees and front wheels when landing

Mohawk Eagle

 • Spread both legs
 • Keep the hips low
 • Point the collarbone upwards
 • Use arms to balance front and back
